basics.name: Tommaso Mencattini
basics.label: MSc Data Science Student & Researcher
basics.summary: MSc student in Data Science at EPFL with research experience at ISTA, ETH Zürich, and GLADIA. My work focuses on large language models, model merging, causal inference, and interpretability. First-author papers at ICML, ACL, and publications at NeurIPS workshops and ECAI.

work.name: Institute of Science and Technology Austria (ISTA)
work.summary: Research in causal learning and multimodal foundation models within the Locatello Group.
highlights: Co-first author for a paper on unsupervised causal effect discovery in RCTs (theory + library).
Developing frameworks combining causality and deep learning for large-scale multimodal systems.

work.name: GLADIA · Sapienza University of Rome
work.summary: Research on scalable model merging, interpretability, and ability estimation for large language models.
highlights: Scaled evolutionary model merging using consumer GPUs (50× speedup, 2% data usage, 85% performance retained).
Two first-author papers accepted to ICML 2025 and ACL 2025.
Co-first author for a paper proving injectivity of LLM representations and presenting the first exact inversion algorithm (viral tweet with 4.7M views).

work.name: ETH Zürich (LRE Lab)
work.summary: Applied causal inference to explain and assess LLM performance on math word problems.
highlights: Worked on applying causal inference techniques to large language models to detect spurious heuristics in reasoning tasks.
Ran large-scale experiments on high-performance computing clusters.

work.name: Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam · KAI Lab
work.summary: Research at the intersection of knowledge graphs and hallucination mitigation in LLMs.
highlights: Designed Text-to-Graph and Graph-to-Text methods for content planning.
Trained and evaluated multiple knowledge-graph-integrated LLMs.

work.name: Sapienza University of Rome
work.summary: NLP research in e-justice applications using specialized large language models.
highlights: Developed GPT-2-based writing assistant for legal documents.

work.name: Network Institute VU Amsterdam
work.summary: Technical support for interdisciplinary projects in XR, VR, and motion capture.
highlights: Worked with Unity, C#, iClone, Motive, and Optitrack.
Organized and presented at Surf XR-On Tour and Reshaping Work 2022 Conference.

courses: Coursework focused on the Mathematics of data science
Honours Programme (30 credits of advanced coursework, e.g. PDEs)
Focused on formal logic and philosophy of language
